Tilendra Choudhary, PhD

Post-doctoral Data Scientist and Researcher

  Dr. Tilendra Choudhary, Ph.D.

   Located at Durham, NC, USA

        

          h-index: 12

Hello

       I am Tilendra Choudhary, a post-doctoral data scientist and researcher at Duke University, USA . I am working at Kamaleswaran Lab led by Dr. Rishikesan Kamaleswaran with a focus on data science, signal processing, and machine learning. Before here, I have worked closely with Emory + GeorgiaTech Univ. (as post-doc) and Brigosha Technologies R&D (as Research Engineer). As an AI enthusiast, I’m endlessly fascinated by new technologies and innovations in the fields of electronics and computer science. My current areas of research and development include physiological signal processing, health informatics, AI and ML for healthcare and for other domains. Apart from research articles, I always enjoy reading spiritual scriptures .

You can find me at these venues:            

You can visit my Short Resume here and my Detailed CV here . I am always looking for folks who are interested in collaborating.

Education details

  • Ph.D., Electronics & Electrical Eng., Indian Institute of Technology Guwahati (IIT G), Assam, India, 2020

  • M.Tech., Electronics & Communication Eng., Indian Institute of Technology Bhubaneswar (IIT BBS), Odisha, India, 2015

  • B.E., Electronics & Telecommunication Eng., Chhattisgarh Swami Vivekanand Technical University (State Govt.), Bhilai, Chhattisgarh, India, 2012

Achievements

  • Review Editor, Biomedical Signal Processing, Frontiers in Signal Processing
  • Topic Editor, Smart Biomedical Signal Analysis with Machine Intelligence, Frontiers in Signal Processing
  • Worked in collaboration with various personals of Evren Technologies Inc., Emory Univ., GeorgiaTech, University of Pittsburgh, MIT, Altanta VA medical center, Duke Univ.
  • Reviewer of many IEEE, Elsevier, Nature, npj and ACM, journals and conferences.
  • Mentored many PhD, MS and undergraduate students.
  • Acomplished various technical projects in software and hardware levels
  • Published many good quality journals and conferences. Details can be found in the “Publications” page.
  • Delivered various technical talks focused on AI, ML and signal processing for healthcare and wearables, in India and USA.

Tip: Remember to appreciate the little things in life.
